definition: to offer (a price) whether for payment or acceptance, to make a bid (see bid entry 2 sense 4) of or in (a suit at cards)
examples: The contractor bid $10,000 less than his nearest competitor.

definition: offer
examples: The poorest man may in his cottage bid defiance to all the forces of the Crown.

definition: to issue an order to : tell
to request to come : invite
beseech, entreat
to give expression to
to make a bid (see bid entry 2)
examples: Several other companies bid on the job.

definition: to seem likely
examples: a movie that bids fair to become a big hit

definition: a statement of what one will give or take for something, an offer of a price
examples: is now accepting bids for the renovation project
made a bid of $100 for the painting

definition: something offered as a bid
the act of one who bids (see bid entry 1)
an opportunity to bid
an attempt or effort to win, achieve, or attract
an announcement of what a cardplayer proposes to undertake
the amount of such a bid
a bridge hand on which one may reasonably bid
invitation
examples: a bid to join the sorority

definition: a sentence or term of imprisonment : a stint in jail
examples: I did my first bid at seventeen for assault, robbery, and burglary in the first degree.

definition: twice a day
bachelor of industrial design
